metadata.title: CVE-2022-34266 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The libtiff-4.0.3-35.amzn2.0.1 package for LibTIFF on Amazon Linux 2 allowsattackers to cause a denial of service (application crash), a differentvulnerability than CVE-2022-0562. When processing a malicious TIFF file, aninvalid range may be passed as an argument to the memset() function withinTIFFFetchStripThing() in tif_dirread.c. This will causeTIFFFetchStripThing() to segfault after use of an uninitialized resource.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34266` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.5
libtiff-tools - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.5
libtiff5 - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.5
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tiff package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.9-5ubuntu0.5').
